ADC }} Air Chief Marshal '''Arup Raha''' ([[Bengali language|Bengali]]: অরূপ রাহা), [[Param Vishisht Seva Medal|PVSM]], [[Ati Vishisht Seva Medal|AVSM]], [[Vayusena Medal|VM]], [[Aide-de-camp|ADC]] is the current [[four star rank|four-star]] [[air officer]] of the Indian Air Force and the 21st and current [[Chief of Air Staff (India)|Chief of the Air Staff]] of the [[Indian Air Force]].{{cite news|title=Arup Raha takes over as IAF chief|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/arup-raha-takes-over-as-iaf-chief/article5522301.ece|publisher=The Hindu|accessdate=31 December 2013|location=Chennai, India|date=2013-12-31}} He is also the current Chairman of Chiefs of Staff Committee, a post occupied by India’s senior-most military officer, who advises the government and ensures jointsmanship in the armed forces.{{cite web|url=http://www.deccanherald.com/content/422782/arup-raha-chief-staff.html |title=Arup Raha is new chief of staff|publisher=Deccan Herald |date= |accessdate=2014-07-30}} Raha previously served as the [[Vice Chief of the Air Staff (India)|Vice Chief of the Air Staff]] of the [[Indian Air Force]] {{cite web|url=http://www.thehindubusinessline.com/news/air-marshal-arup-raha-to-take-over-as-iaf-vice-chief/article4866206.ece |title=Air Marshal Arup Raha to take over as IAF Vice Chief|date= |accessdate=2013-07-03}} and as the [[Air officer commanding|Air Officer Commanding-in-Chief]] (AOC-in-C) of the [[Western Air Command]],{{cite web|url=http://indianairforce.nic.in/show_command.php?pg_id=28&page_type=command&comm_id=3# |title=Central Air Command |publisher=Indianairforce.nic.in |date= |accessdate=2012-06-23}} and that of the [[Central Air Command]]. He has also served as the Senior Air Staff Officer at Headquarters, Western Air Command and Deputy Commandant at [[Air Force Academy, Dundigul|Air Force Academy, Hyderabad]].[http://indianairforce.nic.in/show_page.php?pg_id=18 Air Chief Marshal Arup Raha's official profile] He is a fighter pilot who has logged over 3,400 hours of flying experience.{{cite news|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-04-02/india/28120024_1_western-front-western-air-command-mig-29 |title=Arup Raha takes over as senior Air Staff Officer at WAC - Times Of India |publisher=Articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com |date=2010-04-02 |accessdate=2012-06-23}} == Early life and education == Air Chief Marshal Raha was born on 26 December 1954 in the city of [[Baidyabati]], an area under the [[Kolkata Metropolitan Development Authority]] which is in the Indian State of [[West Bengal]]. His father was a reputed [[Physician|doctor]]. He was educated at [[Sainik School Purulia]] (1970 batch).http://www.indianexpress.com/news/air-marshal-arup-raha-to-be-iaf-chief/1188816/{{cite news|author=Jayanta Gupta|date=January 26, 2012|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-01-26/kolkata/30666563_1_cadets-sainik-schools-ssb-interview |title=Sainik School in Purulia turns 50, Air Marshal to be chief guest - Times Of India |publisher=Articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com |accessdate=2012-06-23}} ==Military Training== Raha was trained at the [[National Defence Academy]], Khadakwasla, India, from July 1970 to June 1973, and at the time of graduating from NDA in June 1973, he was awarded the Gold Medal for being the best cadet of the 44th NDA course. Subsequently, he did flying training on HT-2 and Kiran ( HJT-16 ) at the [[Air Force Academy, Dundigul|Air Force Academy, Hyderabad]], before being commissioned into the Indian Air Force as a fighter pilot in Dec 1974. After flying Hunters in Operational Conversion Unit, he went on to fly Mig -21 aircraft. ==Military career== Raha has flown a wide variety of combat and trainer aircraft. After initial training on the [[HAL HT-2]], he has flown the [[MIG-21]] and [[MIG-29]] aircraft and has commanded a [[MiG-29]] fighter squadron and two frontline airbases along India's Western front. As on April 2, 2010, he had 3,400 hours of flying experience. Raha has held many important staff appointments in India and abroad.
